page.title: 09FARMING. SILAGE AT WILLEY.
page.content: Winter feed for sheep and cattle can be provided by storing grass as; 1) Hay which is dried grass cut & collected in June or July and made into bales to be stored in dry, airy conditions. 2) Silage which is grass cut, chopped and compressed in deep pits which are covered in polythene & weighted down with used car tyres. Silage can also be stored by compressing the chopped grass into huge black plastic bags and covered to protect from mice. The second method enables grass to be cut over a longer period and in less dry weather. Silage is a popular method of providing winter feed at Willey and has resulted in a local shortage of plastic bags in 1985!
